summary: Allows you to run your own ciderhouse restaurant business. Please read description for more details.
descriptionHtml:
Allows you to run your own ciderhouse restaurant. Read further to get into details. It's not difficult once you know the basics, but content is complex and needs explanation and understanding.

[center][b]Introduction to Ciderhouse[/b]
[youtube]To1qZXgWI7w[/youtube][/center]

[center][b]New lightning introduced in RC4[/b]
[youtube]l0z4AxsX60M[/youtube][/center]

[center][b]New waitress and food serve feature introduced in 1.0.0[/b]
[youtube]rQG6FU17vW4[/youtube][/center]

SKYRIM SPECIAL EDITION CONVERSION (by SilentQuim)
--------------------
Thanks to SilentQuim for porting this to SSE.

Conversion available here:
https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/14174


CHANGELOG
---------------------
You can click version number (next to endorsements) for full list, or the version number on the Files section. Also, a plain text changelog is available here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/l843anqqg0651fr/KatixasCiderhouseChangelog.txt

MAIN FEATURES
--------------------
- Brew your cider, cook, and earn money with customers.
- Serve the food yourself to each customer, or hire a waitress
- Apple trees to gather fruits.
- 9 cider barrels, each one with its own fermentation process.
- Bottling machine.
- Ability to open or close the ciderhouse to customers.
- Notebook with your personal notes for tracking barrel status and other information.
- Place orders for meat, fish, bottles, etc...
- Get orders to sell bottled cider (jarls, tavers, citizens...).


QUICK START
---------------------
The Ciderhouse is located right outside Whiterun, next to the Battle-Born farm area. Inside the ciderhouse you will find a journal. It will explain a bit the ciderhouse history, and some basics of how the system works. After this, you will get to control it. Keep in mind that until you read this journal, you can't place orders, receive orders, or open the ciderhouse to customers, as it's not yours.


CIDER BREWING
---------------------
First need apples. You can use green or red apples. You can get them harvesting your own trees (each one gives 8 apples per day), or get them adventuring around (shops, dungeons, etc.).

Apples will need to be placed in the apple press. You will need a minimum of 100 apples to be able to activate the press, but can place as many as you want. When activated, it will create apple juice. This process takes one day. After this is completed, you can move the juice to the decanter. The decanting process takes 2 days. Once finished, you can move the liquid to fermentation. To do this you will need to open the barrels.

Also, keep in mind that once the press is empty (liquid has been moved to decanter) you can again store and press apples. You won't be able to move the juice to the decanter until the previous decanting process is finished and the juice is moved to fermentation, but this will allow you to save some time if you want to fill another barrel.


FERMENTATION BARRELS
---------------------
You own 9 barrels, each with a unique name. Fermentation process takes 5 days. Before using the valve that moves liquid from decanter to barrels, you will need to open an empty barrel, or it will fail.


BOTTLING
---------------------
On the ciderhouse basement there is a bottling machine. It's filled with cider using 9 pipes coming from the barrels at the ciderhouse. You can open the valves you want individually. Cider contained on the barrels (if any) will be moved to bottling machine. Also, you will need to place empty cider bottles on the machine. Activate it and if everything is OK (you have cider and empty bottles), the machine will bottle the cider.

If you have 500 bottles and there's only cider for 200, then 200 bottles will be filled, and 300 will still be available at the machine. If you have 200 bottles and have cider for 300, then 200 bottles will be filled, and the remaining cider will be left there.


FOOD
---------------------
You can cook food at the kitchen, using the places designed for this (for now, the grill / oven). This food will allow you to earn money, as it's consumed by customers, as long as the ciderhouse is open, of course. Food cooked using the default system is not recognized by this mod, so you have to use the oven, because it allows you to select what to cook, and it's added to the ciderhouse menu inventory (the one the customers will use).


WAITRESS AND FOOD SERVING
--------------------------------------------
You can serve the food yourself picking food from the kitchen. Customers awaiting food will have a fork and knife on the table. You get paid for each plate you serve. You can also hire a waitress using a contract book located at Bannered Mare (Whiterun). Call her into the ciderhouse going to the shack she lives while contract is active, just behind the ciderhouse. To go back to work yourself and give her a break, just head to the kitchen and pick food.


ORDERS FOR BUYING AND SELLING
--------------------------------------------------
You can place orders for food, bottles, etc... at different merchants, and the goods will be delivered directly at the delivery boxes located just outside the ciderhouse. Please read the journal at ciderhouse for more information on this.


CASH REGISTER / STRONGBOX
---------------------
This strongbox is located under the main counter. When used, it will contain the gold gathered from customers. They will consume an amount of food per day, so as long as you have something cooked, it will mean profit. You don't need to gather this gold daily, as it will be cumulative, so you can continue adventuring in Skyrim while the ciderhouse produces gold.


OPEN / CLOSE CIDERHOUSE
-------------------------------------------
Right outside the ciderhouse, next to the main door, there's a small sign, represented by a toy-barrel, that allows you to open or close the ciderhouse. There are no official schedules, so you may keep it open 24/7/365, or close it whenever you want. A closed ciderhouse will not have any income, meaning that even if you have 2000 cooked venison chops, you will not sell any.

You can cook a big batch of venison chops and leave the ciderhouse open. Also, leaving it open without food inventory, won't have any negative effects, meaning that you won't lose money at all. For now, the only reason for closing it would be because you set your own schedules, or because you want to be left alone inside (to sleep, decorate, etc.)


UPGRADES
------------------------------------------
You will be able to upgrade your ciderhouse (additional or improved items, decorations, etc.). For now, available upgrades are:
- 14 more apple trees (4000 each, so upgrade costs 56000 gold).

These upgrades are acquired using a book located at Dragonsreach, over a table near the Jarl. When selecting an upgrade you will be prompted with a confirmation message detailing the final amount to pay, so you can agree or cancel.


PROBLEMS ? BUGS ?
---------------------------------
Please, notify me any problem you find. Something that doesn't seem to work as intended, or any bug, so I can try fixing it as soon as I can.


COMPATIBILITY
------------------------
Should be compatible with anything that doesn't place another house in this same area.
Also, cider is NOT compatible with drunk, thirst, or need mods. The reason is simple, it's an item created by this mod, that other mods can't recognize.


TRANSLATIONS
------------------------------------
Japanese (by Solbianca):
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=16709

Chinese (by 616365076):
http://bbs.3dmgame.com/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=3489779&extra=page%3D1%26filter%3Dtypeid%26typeid%3D5940%26typeid%3D5940

Chinese (by maies2330):
http://bbs.skyrimcitizen.net/viewtopic.php?f=25&t=1287
http://bbs.3dmgame.com/thread-4331325-1-1.html

TO-DO
------------------------
There's a huge list of to-dos... but the main ones I would like to mention are:
.More food on the menu (fish, and other stuff).
.More upgrades.


Enjoy!


Steam Workshop link:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=49864702
author: Katixa

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_0
files.changelogHtml:
New upgrade: New ciderhouse entrance (stairs, walls, lamps,....)
Added two holes outside the bottling machine, to check empty cider bottles and available cider.
Added a candle inside the storage room (the one allowing access to upper floor).
Added small candles on the stair to the secret room.
Fixed a spot that could cause player to get stuck with the crates outside.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_1
files.changelogHtml:
Lightning fixed. Should not flicker here and there. This meant removing lots of custom lights.
Fixed (maybe) negative food issue involving higher income than should.
Added a stool on the counter. It can be stored or placed as you wish.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_2
files.changelogHtml:
New menu option: Salad. Use the kitchen table to prepare. Requires one tomato and one lettuce.
Added a button on the press area to toggle the ventilation system (the dwemer noise).

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_3
files.changelogHtml: Quickfix for an upgrade menu that wasn't working.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_4
files.changelogHtml:
You can now renew the waitress contract (add days to it) without waiting it to expire.
New upgrade: 24 additional apple-trees.
Moved all strings from scripts to the ESP, to make it translator-friendly.
Added a changelog in the ciderhouse Notebook (not lore friendly, but good to know latest patch info).
Fixed manual food serving that was allowing to pick food more than once.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_2_5
files.changelogHtml:
Changed the price for the new 24 apple trees from 50000 to 70000 (it was cheaper than adding 14...)
New upgrade: Stone floor (main customer area).
Some fixes in floor tile positions.
Important changes to the bottle amount ordered by jarls, etc.. to make it more balanced.
Added a Ciderhouse Handbook in the counter, to be used as guide.
Added a table at the secret bedroom where you can sit and rewritte the handbook, if lost.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_3_0
files.changelogHtml:
Removed the fixed customers.
Added 20+ new customers that will wander around, dance, sit, etc.. when open.
Added ambience sound (crowd, laughter) to the interior, when open.
Fixed the cider bottle price, which was too hight (thanks webmaster for pointing it out).

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_3_1
files.changelogHtml:
Modified the crowd sound to lower the volume of the annoying laughs.
Fixed female customers using male voices (thanks bmax267).

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_3_2
files.changelogHtml:
Now you get back empty bottles for cider consumed by customers in the ciderhouse (thanks jflgh123 for reporting this mistake).
Added a new barrel in the kitchen where consumed empty bottles are placed automatically.
Fixed an error that added empty bottles to inventory when adding bottles to cider cooler, or when serving orders.
Moved some more strings to variables (for translation mods).
Fixed the Cider Storage information hole, which said Lool, instead of Look.
Fixed the script for manual serving (without waitress), which wasn't giving profit for some recently added food items.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_4
files.changelogHtml:
- IMPORTANT: After upgrade, close and open the ciderhouse, and re-call the waitress to avoid weird behaviour.
- Fixed several errors on some scripts (thanks to all who reported, specially LP1 for the help!)
- As a note, these errors were invisible to players but it seems could cause CTDs for some people.
- New interior upgrade: Additional dining room, on same floor but under the mountain. It doesn't expand the exterior.
- More income (and food use!) with the new upgrade (x3).
- Reduced the number of people on the main dining room.
- Reworked waitress path, which also visits second hall, if upgraded.
- New serving animation for the waitress.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_5
files.changelogHtml:
- Apple harvesting redone.
- Now you get 50 apples per day per tree.
- New virtual skill: Apple harvesting (virtual because it's not on the game menu).
- Apple harvesting increases as you pick apples, from 0 to 100
- As skill goes up, you can harvest more apples per day per tree.
- Now trees stop growing apples after 5 days, instead of 13 (cap).
- With new values you can harvest a max of around 10,000 apples per day.
- With new values you can fill one barrel each day with 2,000 bottles worth cider.
- With new values you can end up with several full barrels after one week.
- Ciderhouse needs now a bit more care to see which barrel is full, which fermenting, etc.
- Lowered the sound volume of the crowd (-30%).
- Fixed a missing reference (thanks kiwifruitxx!).
- A couple fixes to waitress on the new diningroom upgrade.
- Increased again the orders amount for cider. I may adjust it again if it's too low or high.
- Removed the Latest Changes entry from the notebook, as it was a bit lore-breaking.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant 1_5_1
files.changelogHtml:
- Decanting recuded to 1 day (was 2) to avoid bottle-necks.
- Fixed a situation where Apple Harvesting could increase +100.

files.name: Katixas Ciderhouse Restaurant
files.changelogHtml:
- New: New upgrade! Cows. Have your mini-farm of cows (15.000 gold).
- New: You can (unrealisticaly) slaughter one cow per day (use the table, DON'T kill the NPC!!).
- Change: Each beef piece (bought, or farm) gives now 20 steaks, instead of 5 (x4 more).
- New: Your farm cows give 15 beef pieces each (15x20 = 300 steaks).
- New: No matter how many days you've passed without cow slaughter. One per day.
- New: Buy Hay Bale from farm.
- New: Move hay from the bale to hay pile to feed cows.
- New: One hay pile per day. Hay needs to be on the pile before slaughtering.
- Change: Beef now costs 150 on shops, instead of 50 (x3 more).
- Fix: Fixed bug with manual food serving (without waitress). It should work now.
- Fix: Fixed a customer that remainded on secondary dinningroom when ciderhouse closed (thanks Freddywarbird!)
- Fix: Fixed customers chattering on the secondary dinningroom when closing (thanks Freddywarbird!)
- Fix: Fixed farm door outside the ciderhouse, that shouldn't be there.
- Change: New 3D model for served food plate. Model by Jokerine.
- Change: Removed imperial banners from the outdoor upgrade, to be neutral (I may add different options in the future).
- New: Added lettuce and tomato containers on the kitchen (you still need to carry them for salads). Model by Blary.
- New: Added hanging meat container on the kitchen. Model by Blary.
- New: Added knife and cutting table for making salad. Model by Stroti.
- Note: Thanks to anyone I may forgot to mention with ideas or things to fix included on this release.
